title: Unmask ICE

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Unmask ICE
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I want to know if  ICE employees working in Oregon are local citizens who understand the community in which we live, versus employees based in other parts of the country who do not have an understanding of our community. 

In the public interest we need to know who are the numerous individuals claiming to represent ICE who have been documented (1) wearing masks, (2) refusing to show government-issued identification corroborating their affiliation with ICE, CBP, USCIS, and/or local law enforcement. Furthermore, there have been incredibly concerning instances of (3) non-law enforcement agents dressing as legitimate agents who kidnap or attempt to kidnap residents in our community.

As a natural-born US-citizen, I respectfully submit this request to ensure the safety of the community where I reside, and individuals and communities impacted by these activities.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Joana E Kirchhoff

title: Performa Labs (Los Angeles Police Department)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Hello, 

I am seeking records related the department's pilot and use of Performa Labs training software. 
Search 2020 - 2025

Data: 
    The number of participants who received and completed the training, along with their demographic data, including race, name, gender, and position.
    Any quantitative and qualitative data, and other metrics that are collected
    Any information collected through a survey to assess training participants’ satisfaction of the training product or program.

Records also include
Clips, videos, and other media from the training software
Literature: workbooks, reading materials, and any supplemental reading materials 
The names and descriptions of the training selected and used. This could include the names of each module/course and the descriptions of each scenario.
Course outlines
Performa Labs marketing materials and user guides

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Joey Scott

title: ALPR audit

communications.subject: The Missouri Sunshine Law Request: ALPR audit
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the The Missouri Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

1. Organization Audit in Flock.
The report should include data logged from the period of January 1, 2025, to the date this request is processed. Per Flock's documentation, the Organization Audit is available within the Insights tab and is defined as searches done within the agency.

2. Network Audit in Flock.
The report should include data logged from the period of January 1, 2025, to the date this request is processed. Per Flock's documentation, the Network Audit is available within the Insights tab and is defined as searches of the organization’s Flock network by any agency in the Flock System.

3. A list of network share settings that include:
3a. Flock networks shared with me
3b. Networks that I’m sharing

Please provide records in their original electronic, machine readable format. For example, please provide csv or spreadsheet files where applicable.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Scott Kampas

communications.communication:

communications.subject: PRR 2025-185 FDEM comms re: Alligator Alcatraz Billboard
communications.communication:
Good afternoon,

Thank you for contacting the Florida Division of Emergency Management.  This email is to acknowledge that the Division has received your public records request and will process it in accordance with Florida Public Records Law and in the order in which it was received. Your request has been logged and assigned a PRR tracking number.

Please note that the Division is authorized by section 119.07(4)(d), Florida Statutes, to assess a special charge for excessive use of agency resources. If there is such a charge, we will contact you with a cost estimate prior to producing the records.

We appreciate your understanding and will work to provide the responsive records as soon as possible or a cost estimate prior to producing the records.  If you have any questions, please let us know.

Thank you,

Tesha DeMuth
Paralegal /  Agency Clerk
Office of General Counsel
Florida Division of Emergency Management
2555 Shumard Oak Blvd, Tallahassee, FL 32399-7018
Office: 850-815-4155
Work Cell: 448-229-9323
Tesha.DeMuth@em.myflorida.com<mailto:Tesha.DeMuth@em.myflorida.com>

[cid:image001.jpg@01DBF4CF.2A288DB0]
Most written communications to or from state employees are public records obtainable by the public upon request.  Emails sent to me at this email address may be considered public and will only be withheld from disclosure if deemed confidential pursuant to the laws of the State of Florida.


Under Florida law, correspondence with the Florida Division of Emergency Management concerning agency business that is neither confidential nor exempt pursuant to Florida Statutes is a public record and will be made available to the public upon request.

Joey Scott

title: Records Pertaining to Colonel Kurush Bharucha-Reid (“KB Reid”) (US Army Intelligence and Security Command (INSCOM))

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Records Pertaining to Colonel Kurush Bharucha-Reid (“KB Reid”) (US Army Intelligence and Security Command (INSCOM))
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

This request seeks all records from 1995 (or earlier) to 2010 (or later if available) referencing Colonel Kurush Bharucha-Reid (also known as “KB Reid”), a U.S. Army Military Intelligence officer who was selected for the Military Intelligence Excepted Career Program (GREAT SKILL) in 1987 and subsequently served in some of the most sensitive Army and interagency HUMINT roles of the post–Cold War and post-9/11 era.

I respectfully request:

	1.	Personnel Records
	•	Official Military Personnel File (OMPF), Officer Evaluation Reports (OERs), commendations, promotions, awards, fitness reports, assignment orders, and internal performance evaluations for Colonel Kurush Bharucha-Reid (SSN/Service Number can be provided if required).
	•	Decorations including: Defense Superior Service Medal, Bronze Star (with Oak Leaf Cluster), Defense Meritorious Service Medal (x3), Meritorious Service Medal (x3), Joint Service Commendation Medal, Army Commendation Medal (with Oak Leaf Cluster), Army Achievement Medal, Ranger tab, Special Forces tab, Pathfinder, Master Parachutist, and Military Free Fall Jump Master badges ￼.
	2.	Program and Command Assignments
	•	All records documenting his service in the GREAT SKILL Program, including appointment, reassignment memos, or internal assessments.
	•	His service as Regional Desk Officer and Special Assistant for Military Affairs at a national-level intelligence agency, with a focus on East Asian and Near East operations.
	•	Records from his time as Commander of a Defense HUMINT Service base in Bosnia, and as CJ2 for Combined Joint Task Force Fervent Archer.
	•	Documentation from his command of a sensitive HUMINT collection detachment deployed to Afghanistan (2002), where he served as the first HUMINT case officer supporting U.S. Special Operations Command (USSOCOM).
	•	Records from his second Afghanistan deployment (2004), where he commanded a HUMINT base supporting surge operations during Afghanistan’s first democratic elections.
	•	Internal records, rosters, orders, or awards tied to his 2005 Iraq deployment as a Senior HUMINT Advisor in a sensitive interagency coordination cell.
	3.	Strategic Instruction & Final Command
	•	Records of his time as Chief of the Military Group and Senior DoD Instructor at a joint interagency strategic intelligence training institution (likely DIA or a multi-agency DoD school).
	•	Materials from his command of the U.S. Army Field Support Center (AFSC) beginning in May 2009, including speeches, directives, or internal comms.
	•	Any documentation of his death from pancreatic cancer in 2010, honors received, or correspondence related to his funeral and burial at Arlington National Cemetery on September 9, 2010.
	4.	Legacy Sites and Honors
	•	Records regarding the 2011 naming of the DIA Contingency Operating Base in Kabul as Camp K.B. Reid, including naming justification, interagency approvals, and dedication ceremony photos or memos.
	•	Materials related to the Reid Center (DIA’s training facility in Norfolk, VA, established in 2012 and now closed).
	•	The establishment of the COL Kurush Bharucha-Reid Award for Excellence in HUMINT Tradecraft in 2014 by the HUMINT Training – Joint Center of Excellence, including award criteria, selection board minutes, and awardee names.
	•	Any correspondence, ceremony documentation, or Hall of Fame entry details from his 2014 induction into the Military Intelligence Corps Hall of Fame ￼.
	5.	Photographic and Ceremonial Records
	•	All official photographs, eulogies, obituaries, citations, press releases, internal honors, or other agency acknowledgments related to Col. Bharucha-Reid, both during service and posthumously.
	6.	Classified and Segregable Records
	•	If any records are classified, please initiate a mandatory declassification review (MDR) under Executive Order 13526 and release all segregable non-exempt portions under FOIA guidelines.
	7.	Delivery and Fee Waiver
	•	Please provide documents in searchable PDF format via secure email or download link.

This request supports a public-interest historical and educational project—specifically, a feature film titled Undercover Patriot exploring the intersection of identity, secrecy, and service. 

As a fellow Parsi Zoroastrian American, I believe Col. Bharucha-Reid’s legacy deserves recognition beyond the classified corridors in which he served.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Adil Minocherhomjee

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request: Records Pertaining to Colonel Kurush Bharucha-Reid (“KB Reid”) (US Army Intelligence and Security Command (INSCOM))
communications.communication:
Sir/Ma’am,

Our office is in receipt of your FOIA request.

After reviewing your request, we have determined your request is too broad a topic to meet our search criteria.  It is suggested that you narrow the scope of your request.  Suggestions include providing the specific units and years that should be searched.

Your request would require an excessive number of hours to search and locate any responsive records.  Professional Hours of Search would be billed at $44.00 an hour.  This cost is strictly for professional search and does not include professional review of any located records or reproduction costs.  Additionally, we cannot guarantee that the information you are seeking would be located.

We will not continue to process your request pending your response. If we do not receive a response within 30 days your request will be automatically closed without further action.

V/r,

Samantha Lance

	•	Records regarding the 2011 naming of the DIA Contingency Operating Base in Kabul as Camp K.B. Reid, including naming justification, interagency approvals, and dedication ceremony photos or memos.
	•	Materials related to the Reid Center (DIA’s training facility in Norfolk, VA, established in 2012 and now closed).
	•	The establishment of the COL Kurush Bharucha-Reid Award for Excellence in HUMINT Tradecraft in 2014 by the HUMINT Training – Joint Center of Excellence, including award criteria, selection board minutes, and awardee names.
	•	Any correspondence, ceremony documentation, or Hall of Fame entry details from his 2014 induction into the Military Intelligence Corps Hall of Fame ￼.
	5.	Photographic and Ceremonial Records
	•	All official photographs, eulogies, obituaries, citations, press releases, internal honors, or other agency acknowledgments related to Col. Bharucha-Reid, both during service and posthumously.
	6.	Classified and Segregable Records
	•	If any records are classified, please initiate a mandatory declassification review (MDR) under Executive Order 13526 and release all segregable non-exempt portions under FOIA guidelines.
	7.	Delivery and Fee Waiver
	•	Please provide documents in searchable PDF format via secure email or download link.

This request supports a public-interest historical and educational project—specifically, a feature film titled Undercover Patriot exploring the intersection of identity, secrecy, and service. 

As a fellow Parsi Zoroastrian American, I believe Col. Bharucha-Reid’s legacy deserves recognition beyond the classified corridors in which he served.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Adil Minocherhomjee

title: Muhammadu Buhari (17 December 1942 – 13 July 2025)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Muhammadu Buhari (17 December 1942 – 13 July 2025)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records mentioning, relating to, or generated as a result of investigation or inquiry into former Nigerian leader Muhammadu Buhari (17 December 1942 – 13 July 2025). His death is widely-known and widely reported; as such, privacy concerns under FOIA Exemptions 6 and 7 are voided, as are any concerns under the Privacy Act. For example, you may find his Washington Post obituary at the following link: https://www.washingtonpost.com/obituaries/2025/07/13/muhammadu-buhari-nigeria-dead/

Please conduct a search of the Central Records System, including but not limited to the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Indices, the Microphone Surveillance (MISUR) Indices, the Physical Surveillance (FISUR) Indices, and the Technical Surveillance (TESUR) Indices, for both main-file records and cross-reference records of both HQ and all field offices for all relevant names, agencies, organizations, companies and events including but not limited to those cited in the previous paragraphs and/or links as well as a cross-reference with the Southern Poverty Law Center to include any information provided by the SPLC. My request includes but is not limited to 137, 157, 176, 177, 183, 184, 188, and 214 files. If previously released records are available, then I request a rolling release consisting of those records while additional records are located and processed for release.

If any part of these documents are exempt from disclosure, please be sure to review and release all reasonably segregable nonexempt portions of responsive documents, as the FOIA requires.

I request that I be properly classified as a media requester. I am an assistant editor at Reason Magazine who has written numerous articles on topics of public interest, and I am requesting these documents in an editorial capacity. title: Request for First, Last Names and Government-Issued ID photos of ICE Officials Operating in Oregon, USA (Internal Revenue Service)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Request for First, Last Names and Government-Issued ID photos of ICE Officials Operating in Oregon, USA (Internal Revenue Service)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

This is a matter of public interest in order to understand if the ICE employees are local citizens who understand the community in which we live, versus employees based in other parts of the country who do not have an understanding of our community. 

This request furthers public interest given, in particular, that numerous individuals claiming to represent ICE have been documented (1) wearing masks, (2) refusing to show government-issued identification corroborating their affiliation with ICE, CBP, USCIS, and/or local law enforcement. Furthermore, there have been incredibly concerning instances of (3) non-LEOs dressing as LEOs who kidnap or attempt to kidnap residents in our community.

As a white, natural-born US-citizen, I respectfully submit this request to ensure the safety of the community where I reside, the State of Oregon, and individuals and communities impacted by these activities.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Lauren M. Kerr

As a white, natural-born US-citizen, I respectfully submit this request to ensure the safety of the community where I reside, the State of Oregon, and individuals and communities impacted by these activities.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Lauren M. Kerr

title: Tiger Team

communications.subject: DC Freedom of Information Act Request: Tiger Team
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the DC Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I seek all records related to a special Department of Homeland Security task force known internally as the “Tiger Team.” 

On July 10, 2025, Homeland Security Investigations official Peter Hatch testified in American Association of University Professors v. U.S. Department of Justice, Civ. No. 1:25-cv-10910 (D. Mass). Hatch testified that in early 2025, DHS convened a special task force known internally as the “Tiger Team”  to identify noncitizens protesting against Israel’s ongoing genocide of the Palestinian people, revoke their legal immigration status, and have them deported.

I request all records related to the Tiger Team. These include, without limitation:

1. All records related to the conception and creation of Tiger Team. 
2. Records sufficient to identify the structure, composition, and membership of Tiger Team. 
3. Records sufficient to identify the mission and mandate of Tiger Team.
4. All records related to the activities of Tiger Team.
5. Records sufficient to identify all other government persons and entities with which Tiger Team has collaborated, interacted, or corresponded.
6. Records sufficient to identify all non-government persons and entities with which Tiger Team has collaborated, interacted, or corresponded.
7. All records related to the oversight of Tiger Team, including records sufficient to identify the persons and entities responsible for that oversight.

Date Range: November 5, 2024 to July 12, 2025.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 15 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Francis Lee Maidir

communications.communication:
